translated: Record of Temples in the Capital of the Liang Dynasty
No Name
Xiao Zhuangyan Temple Xiao Zhuangyan Temple
Xiao Zhuangyan Temple of the Liang Dynasty.
Located in Dingyin Lane in Jianye.
Originally the site of the temple of the Prince of Lingling of the Jin Dynasty.
In the sixth year of the Tianjian era, Chan Master Du initiated the construction.
At that time, there was Shao Wenli.
His family had been in the business of slaughtering animals for generations.
Once, he wanted to kill a deer.
The deer knelt down and shed tears.
He considered it an inauspicious sign.
The deer was pregnant with a fawn.

analyzed: 尋當產育。 就庖哀切。
translated: It was about to give birth.
It was brought to the slaughterhouse, wailing piteously.🔽It was skinned alive together with its unborn child.
Because of this, he fell ill.
His eyebrows and beard all fell out.
His body was covered with sores.
Later, he deeply regretted his actions and sought the Way.
Chan Master Du made a great vow.
He emptied his family's wealth and bought back the land.
He established a monastery.

original: 同泰寺同泰寺梁武帝改年號大同。
analyzed: 同泰寺同泰寺梁武帝改年號大同。
translated: Tongtai Temple Tongtai Temple. Emperor Wu of the Liang changed the reign name to Datong.
He built Tongtai Temple.
It was located within the imperial city.
He exhausted the treasury.
He built a seven-story Buddha Hall.
It was burned by fire.
Emperor Wu donated his body and wealth.
To pray for the blessings of the Buddha.
Since the Great Tong period.
There has been no unfortunate year.

original: 興國禪寺興國禪寺梁武帝天監十三年。
analyzed: 興國禪寺興國禪寺梁武帝天監十三年。
translated: Xinguo Chan Temple Xinguo Chan Temple, in the thirteenth year of the Tianjian era of Emperor Wu of the Liang Dynasty.
With 200,000 strings of cash.
Exchanged the front hill of Dinglin for the solitary dragon hill.
To bury Zhizang.
Princess Yongding used the funds for bathing and washing.
Built a five-story pagoda on top of it.
In the fourteenth year.
In front of the pagoda, Kaishan Temple was built.

original: 昇元寺昇元寺昇元寺即瓦棺寺也。
analyzed: 昇元寺昇元寺昇元寺即瓦棺寺也。
translated: Shengyuan Temple Shengyuan Temple is the same as Waguang Temple.
It is located at the western edge of the city overlooking the river.
In the back, it occupies a lofty hill, which is the most ancient site.
It has been through many wars and fires.
There is almost nothing left.
At the time of Emperor Li, the Shengyuan Pavilion was still there.
It was an old object of the Liang Dynasty.

original: 大愛敬寺大愛敬寺梁武帝普通元年造。
analyzed: 大愛敬寺大愛敬寺梁武帝普通元年造。
translated: Dagaijing Temple Dagaijing Temple was built in the first year of the Putong era of Emperor Wu of the Liang Dynasty.
Located on the high peak north of Mount Jiang.

original: 法寶寺法寶寺梁同泰寺基之半也。
analyzed: 法寶寺法寶寺梁同泰寺基之半也。
translated: Fabao Temple, half of the foundation of Liang Tongtai Temple.
Record of Temples in Jiankang.
In the first year of Datong of Emperor Wu of Liang.
Established Tongtai Temple.
The temple is located behind the palace.
A separate gate is opened.
Named Datong Gate.
The emperor discusses in the morning and evening.
Often visits this gate.

original: 法光寺法光寺即梁之蕭帝寺。
analyzed: 法光寺法光寺即梁之蕭帝寺。
translated: Faguang Temple, Faguang Temple is the Xiaodi Temple of Liang Dynasty.
Old records.
Built in the thirteenth year of Tianjian.
Yuanjiang Temple Record says.
I do not know the name from the past.
Therefore, later people refer to it with the imperial surname.

original: 寶林寺寶林寺梁天監中。
analyzed: 寶林寺寶林寺梁天監中。
translated: Baolin Temple, Baolin Temple was built in the Tianjian period of Liang Dynasty.
Emperor Wu and Master Bao.
Together visited this mountain.
Seeing the extraordinary scenery of the forest and hills.
Ordered to build a monastery.

original: 長于寺長于寺建康南五里有山岡。
analyzed: 長于寺長于寺建康南五里有山岡。
translated: Changyu Temple, Changyu Temple is five li south of Jiankang. There is a mountain ridge.
On the flat ground in between.
Common people live mixed together.

original: 有大長于．小長于．東長于．並是地名。
analyzed: 有大長于．小長于．東長于．並是地名。
translated: There were Dajianyu, Xiaojianyu, and Dongjianyu, all of which were place names.
Xiaojianyu was south of Waguan Temple.
At the west end of the alley, it flowed into the great river.
In the early Liang dynasty, Changyu Temple was built.
